metadata.title: CVE-2016-5139 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in the opj_tcd_init_tile function in tcd.c inOpenJPEG, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.116, allowremote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow)or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JPEG 2000 data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
No subscription required

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307').
openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1').
